item.title: BUILDING LOAD BALANCERS
item.description: What is a Load Balancer? Load balancers are networking resources that take in network traffic through their frontend and distribute that traffic to their backend(s). Load balancers have a few general attributes: Frontend Where clients reach the load balancer, the “face” of the load balancer. Backend The server(s) where the load balancer directs traffic Forwarding Rules The logic the load balancer uses to distribute traffic.
